intro: Pedicularis densispica subsp. densispica, commonly known as the dense-hairy lousewort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its morphology and ecological niche reflect adaptations to its high-altitude environment.
